sect1.title: Conceptual Overview
sect1.para: &susemgr; is an open source (GPLv2) Linux system management solution that simplifies the following tasks:

listitem.para: inventorying your systems (hardware and software information),
installing and updating software on your systems,
building groups to apply (custom) software packages to individual, systems
managing and deploying configuration files to your systems,
distributing content across multiple geographical sites in an efficient manner.

sect1.para: &susemgr;'s main purpose is to efficiently manage a set of Linux systems and keep them up-to-date. This is done by connecting &susemgr; to package and update sources, organized as repositories.

Repositories are grouped into channels which are assigned to client systems. &susemgr; then compares packages installed on the clients with packages available in assigned channels and reports any uninstalled updates.
